title: Metro Bank founder Vernon Hill becomes 'emeritus chairman'
text:
Metro Bank founder Vernon Hill has become "emeritus chairman" after stepping down immediately as chairman of the embattled lender.

He will be replaced on an interim basis by City grandee Sir Michael Snyder, who joined Metro's board in 2015. The former City of London policy chairman had been tipped as a replacement for Mr Hill.

The American billionaire had vowed over the summer to remain on Metro's board, but earlier this month Metro said Mr Hill would relinquish his seat as well as his chairman role.

Metro has suffered a torrid year in the wake of an accounting scandal that send its share price tumbling.
